intro: Rinorea mexicana, commonly known as Mexican velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Rinorea mexicana is also known for its fibrous stems, which have been used in traditional crafts and textiles.
